message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.GT, cs.MM, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of material estimation from a single color image, which is a common problem in computer vision and graphics. The paper proposes an end-to-end approach that uses deep convolutional encoder-decoder architectures and image-to-image translation techniques to estimate material properties such as specular albedo and material shininess. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories. The paper also proposes a novel perceptual rendering loss, which suggests that it may also belong to the graphics (cs.GR) and multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories. The paper's use of deep learning techniques and its focus on real-time performance suggests that it may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on mixed reality applications suggests that it may also belong to the graphics (cs.GR) and geometric modeling (cs.GT) sub-categories.
